sections.label: What are you most interested in this course?
options: Understanding what the Bible really is
Learning how the Bible is structured
Seeing how the Bible connects to Jesus
Knowing how the Bible applies to my life

responses.Understanding what the Bible really is: Awesome! We'll help you discover what the Bible is all about — not just a book, but God's message to us.
responses.Learning how the Bible is structured: Great! We'll walk through how the Bible is organized so you feel confident navigating it.
responses.Seeing how the Bible connects to Jesus: Wonderful! You'll see how the whole Bible points to Jesus, from Genesis to Revelation.
responses.Knowing how the Bible applies to my life: Love that! We'll focus on making the Bible feel personal — showing how God's Word speaks to your everyday life.

enhanced.title: God’s Word
enhanced.description:
The Bible is one big story made up of 66 books.
• It reveals God’s love and plan to restore people.

enhanced.title: Two Main Parts
enhanced.description:
Old Testament → Before Jesus, about God’s promises.
New Testament → The life of Jesus and the early Church.

enhanced.title: Why It Matters
enhanced.description:
The Bible helps us grow in faith and make wise choices.
• It guides how we live and connects us with God.

enhanced.title: What You'll Learn
enhanced.description: We'll explore the Bible’s structure, how to read it, and why it still matters today.

sections.label: Old Testament
sections.text: The Old Testament has 39 books. It includes:

enhanced.title: Wisdom
enhanced.description:
Job–Song of Solomon
• Psalm 23: 'The Lord is my shepherd.'

sections.label: New Testament
sections.text: The New Testament has 27 books. It includes:

enhanced.title: Gospels
enhanced.description:
Matthew–John
• The life and teachings of Jesus
• Sermon on the Mount – Matthew 5

enhanced.title: Acts
enhanced.description:
The early church’s growth and mission
• Peter’s bold preaching – Acts 2

enhanced.title: Epistles
enhanced.description:
Romans–Jude
• Letters with guidance for Christian living
• 1 Corinthians 13 on love

enhanced.title: Revelation
enhanced.description:
A vision of hope and Jesus’ return
• Revelation 21:4 — God wipes every tear

subUnits.title: The Inspiration and Authority of Scripture

enhanced.title: Inspiration of the Bible
enhanced.description:
The Bible was written by people but inspired by the Holy Spirit.
• God gave Moses the Law – Exodus
• Paul wrote letters to churches – Romans

enhanced.title: Authority of the Bible
enhanced.description:
The Bible is the final authority for what Christians believe and how we live.
• Jesus quoted Scripture when tempted – Matthew 4

sections.label: Quick Quiz
sections.question: Who inspired the writers of the Bible?

sections.label: Think About This
sections.question: How does it help you trust the Bible more knowing it’s inspired?

scripture.text: Above all, you must understand that no prophecy of Scripture came about by the prophet’s own interpretation. For prophecy never had its origin in human will, but prophets, though human, spoke from God as they were carried along by the Holy Spirit.

sections.prompt: Knowing that the Bible was written by people but inspired by God helps us trust its message. You're not just reading human opinions—you're reading God's truth.
sections.inputPlaceholder: How does this shape your view of the Bible?

enhanced.title: God’s Revelation
enhanced.description:
The Bible reveals who God is.
• Exodus 34:6 – God is compassionate, gracious, and loving.

enhanced.title: Spiritual Growth
enhanced.description:
Reading Scripture helps our faith grow.
• Romans 10:17 – Faith comes from hearing.
• Matthew 6 – Learn to pray.
• Galatians 5:22–23 – Grow in character.

sections.label: Think About This
sections.question: How can reading the Bible bring real change in your life?

scripture.text: For the word of God is alive and active. Sharper than any double-edged sword... it judges the thoughts and attitudes of the heart.

sections.prompt: The Bible isn't just information—it's transformation. It teaches, comforts, and leads us to become more like Jesus.
